title: How to Make Money with 500px

steps.headline: Go to https://500px.com/directory in a web browser.
steps.description: Open your preferred web browser and navigate to the 500px Photographer Directory. The 500px Directory is a website that connects clients with photographers they can hire for specific assignments. You’ll create a profile that displays your rates, services, location, equipment, availability, and other information that can help you land well-paying gigs. Begin by browsing the profiles of other photographers to get an idea of what to put into your profile. You must have a Pro or Pro+ account to list your services in the Directory. You can also list your services when you’re still in the 14-day free trial period.

steps.headline: Scroll down and click Sign up.
steps.description: It’s the blue button at the bottom of the page. If you’re not already signed in to 500px in your web browser, follow the on-screen instructions to sign in now.

steps.headline: Fill out the profile form and click Next.
steps.description: Enter your name, company name (if applicable), and other requested personal details. In the ″Biography″ section, introduce yourself and describe your work to your potential clients. If you have a website or social media accounts for your photography practice, enter the URLs into the blanks at the bottom of the form. Clients can then follow these links to see more of your work.

steps.headline: Select the services you offer from the ″Service type″ drop-down menu.
steps.description: It’s the menu at the top of the page.

steps.headline: List your specialties.
steps.description:
Your specialties a list of the subjects or mediums you work with. To list your specialties:
Click the ″Select specialties″ drop-down menu to view the list. Click a specialty to select it. Click ＋ Add another specialty to add additional specialties.

steps.headline: List your rates.
steps.description: If you know what you’d like to charge for your services, check the box next to ″I have service rates,″ and then enter your rates (daily and/or hourly).

steps.headline: List your equipment.
steps.description:
Clients will want to know that you have the right tools for the job. To list your equipment:
Type your camera information into the ″Cameras″ field. To add more cameras, click ＋ Add another camera, and then enter the next model. Check the boxes for other equipment you have (e.g., Tripod, Wide angle lens) in the ″Other″ section.

steps.headline: Enter the language(s) you speak.
steps.description: Select a language from the first drop-down menu under ″Languages,″ and the fluency level from the second drop-down menu. If you speak more than one language, tap Add another language, then add that language and fluency level.

steps.headline: List your work availability.
steps.description: Tap the boxes next to each time of day you’re available for shoots.

steps.headline: Click Next.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom of the form.

steps.headline: Upload your best photos for each specialty.
steps.description:
You can add anywhere from 4 to 8 photos for each specialty you selected. To add photos:
Click the ＋ in the first box beneath the first specialty. Click Upload a new photo if the photo is on your Android, or Choose from Library to select one you’ve already uploaded to 500px. Browse to the photo location and select the photo. Repeat the process to upload additional photos.

steps.headline: Click Finish.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom of the page.

steps.headline: Click Complete your profile.
steps.description: It’s the blue button near the center of the page. Your Directory profile is now complete. Clients will now see your profile when searching for photographers who fit their needs. If you haven’t yet completed your regular 500px profile, you’ll be prompted to do so. Fill out your personal info, then tap Save.

steps.headline: Go to https://www.500px.com in a web browser.
steps.description: Use any web browser to navigate to the 500px main website. As a 500px member, you can sell your photos through their stock photo marketplace. If you’re not already signed in to your account, click Log In at the top-right corner of the screen, then follow the on-screen instructions to sign in.

steps.headline: Hover the mouse over your profile photo.
steps.description: It's in the top-right corner of the page. This opens a drop-down menu.

steps.headline: Click My Settings.
steps.description: It’s at the center of the drop-down menu.

steps.headline: Click the LICENSING tab.
steps.description: It’s at the top of the screen beneath the search bar.

steps.headline: Click Contribute to 500px Licensing.
steps.description: It’s the blue button at the top of the page.

steps.headline: Click Submit for licensing next to the photo you want to sell.
Review and accept the licensing agreement.
steps.description: To read the agreement, click Contributor Licensing Agreement under Step 1, and then check the box to accept.

steps.headline: Upload model release forms.
steps.description: If your photos contain recognizable people, you must share each model’s signed release form with 500px. If you’re not sure whether you need a form, see the  model release guide for more information. You can download a free blank model release form template by clicking blank model release under Step 2. To upload a signed form, click Upload release, then select the file from your computer. If you can’t provide release forms, you can still offer a limited use version of the photo to buyers. People can still buy the photo, but they won’t be able to use it for commercial purposes.

steps.headline: Upload property owner release forms.
steps.description: If your photo contains artwork, logos, or other recognizable property, you’ll need the owner to sign release forms so you can share them with 500px. If you need a blank release form, click blank property release under Step 3. To upload a signed form, click Upload release, then select the file from your computer. If you can’t provide release forms, you can still offer a limited use version of the photo to buyers. People can still buy the photo, but they won’t be able to use it for commercial purposes.

steps.headline: Choose whether to make your photo available for editorial use only (optional).
steps.description: If you couldn’t provide release forms for models or property featured in the photo, check the box under Step 4 to request a license that approves the photo for editorial use only. This means that buyers can’t use your photo for marketing/advertising purposes, however, they can still use it for non-commercial purposes.

steps.headline: Decide if you want to license the image exclusively.
steps.description: If this photo has never been licensed commercially and you don’t want to make it available for sale elsewhere, check the box to give 500px exclusive rights to the photo. This option is the most lucrative, as you’ll earn 60% of total photo sales. If the photo has been licensed for commercial use in the past OR you want to sell it through another marketplace, do not check the box. You will still earn 30% of net sales with a non-exclusive license.

steps.headline: Select the number of people in the photo.
steps.description: Check the box under Step 6 that describes how many humans (if any) are in the photo.

steps.headline: Select a location.
steps.description: Check Indoor, Outdoor, or N/A under Step 7 to describe where you took the photo.

steps.headline: Click Submit.
steps.description: It’s the button at the bottom of the form. Your license request will be processed by 500px’s licensing team. 500px will contact you if they need more information to process your license. Once your photo is licensed, it will be listed for sale through Getty Images and other partners.

text:
Joining the Photographer Directory Go to https://500px.com/directory in a web browser. Open your preferred web browser and navigate to the 500px Photographer Directory. The 500px Directory is a website that connects clients with photographers they can hire for specific assignments. You’ll create a profile that displays your rates, services, location, equipment, availability, and other information that can help you land well-paying gigs. Begin by browsing the profiles of other photographers to get an idea of what to put into your profile. You must have a Pro or Pro+ account to list your services in the Directory. You can also list your services when you’re still in the 14-day free trial period. Scroll down and click Sign up. It’s the blue button at the bottom of the page. If you’re not already signed in to 500px in your web browser, follow the on-screen instructions to sign in now. Fill out the profile form and click Next. Enter your name, company name (if applicable), and other requested personal details. In the ″Biography″ section, introduce yourself and describe your work to your potential clients. If you have a website or social media accounts for your photography practice, enter the URLs into the blanks at the bottom of the form. Clients can then follow these links to see more of your work. Select the services you offer from the ″Service type″ drop-down menu. It’s the menu at the top of the page. List your specialties. Your specialties a list of the subjects or mediums you work with. To list your specialties:
Click the ″Select specialties″ drop-down menu to view the list. Click a specialty to select it. Click ＋ Add another specialty to add additional specialties. List your rates. If you know what you’d like to charge for your services, check the box next to ″I have service rates,″ and then enter your rates (daily and/or hourly). List your equipment. Clients will want to know that you have the right tools for the job. To list your equipment:
Type your camera information into the ″Cameras″ field. To add more cameras, click ＋ Add another camera, and then enter the next model. Check the boxes for other equipment you have (e.g., Tripod, Wide angle lens) in the ″Other″ section. Enter the language(s) you speak. Select a language from the first drop-down menu under ″Languages,″ and the fluency level from the second drop-down menu. If you speak more than one language, tap Add another language, then add that language and fluency level. List your work availability. Tap the boxes next to each time of day you’re available for shoots. Click Next. It’s at the bottom of the form. Upload your best photos for each specialty. You can add anywhere from 4 to 8 photos for each specialty you selected. To add photos:
Click the ＋ in the first box beneath the first specialty. Click Upload a new photo if the photo is on your Android, or Choose from Library to select one you’ve already uploaded to 500px. Browse to the photo location and select the photo. Repeat the process to upload additional photos. Click Finish. It’s at the bottom of the page. Click Complete your profile. It’s the blue button near the center of the page. Your Directory profile is now complete. Clients will now see your profile when searching for photographers who fit their needs. If you haven’t yet completed your regular 500px profile, you’ll be prompted to do so. Fill out your personal info, then tap Save. Selling Your Photos Go to https://www.500px.com in a web browser. Use any web browser to navigate to the 500px main website. As a 500px member, you can sell your photos through their stock photo marketplace. If you’re not already signed in to your account, click Log In at the top-right corner of the screen, then follow the on-screen instructions to sign in. Hover the mouse over your profile photo. It's in the top-right corner of the page. This opens a drop-down menu. Click My Settings. It’s at the center of the drop-down menu. Click the LICENSING tab. It’s at the top of the screen beneath the search bar. Click Contribute to 500px Licensing. It’s the blue button at the top of the page. Click Submit for licensing next to the photo you want to sell.  Review and accept the licensing agreement. To read the agreement, click Contributor Licensing Agreement under Step 1, and then check the box to accept. Upload model release forms. If your photos contain recognizable people, you must share each model’s signed release form with 500px. If you’re not sure whether you need a form, see the  model release guide for more information. You can download a free blank model release form template by clicking blank model release under Step 2. To upload a signed form, click Upload release, then select the file from your computer. If you can’t provide release forms, you can still offer a limited use version of the photo to buyers. People can still buy the photo, but they won’t be able to use it for commercial purposes. Upload property owner release forms. If your photo contains artwork, logos, or other recognizable property, you’ll need the owner to sign release forms so you can share them with 500px. If you need a blank release form, click blank property release under Step 3. To upload a signed form, click Upload release, then select the file from your computer. If you can’t provide release forms, you can still offer a limited use version of the photo to buyers. People can still buy the photo, but they won’t be able to use it for commercial purposes. Choose whether to make your photo available for editorial use only (optional). If you couldn’t provide release forms for models or property featured in the photo, check the box under Step 4 to request a license that approves the photo for editorial use only. This means that buyers can’t use your photo for marketing/advertising purposes, however, they can still use it for non-commercial purposes. Decide if you want to license the image exclusively. If this photo has never been licensed commercially and you don’t want to make it available for sale elsewhere, check the box to give 500px exclusive rights to the photo. This option is the most lucrative, as you’ll earn 60% of total photo sales. If the photo has been licensed for commercial use in the past OR you want to sell it through another marketplace, do not check the box. You will still earn 30% of net sales with a non-exclusive license. Select the number of people in the photo. Check the box under Step 6 that describes how many humans (if any) are in the photo. Select a location. Check Indoor, Outdoor, or N/A under Step 7 to describe where you took the photo. Click Submit. It’s the button at the bottom of the form. Your license request will be processed by 500px’s licensing team. 500px will contact you if they need more information to process your license. Once your photo is licensed, it will be listed for sale through Getty Images and other partners.
